originContent: Ex.Co. (Extensible Coder) is a GUI text editor written in Python that uses PyQt/QScintilla libraries with some lexers available in Cython for more efficient text highlighting.
translatedContent: Ex.Co. (Extensible Coder) is a GUI text editor written in Python that uses PyQt/QScintilla libraries with some lexers available in Cython for more efficient text highlighting.

originContent: I developed it with simplicity of use and extensibility in mind.
translatedContent: I developed it with simplicity of use and extensibility in mind.

originContent: For precompiled bundles for Windows see the releases page (https://github.com/matkuki/ExCo/releases/latest).
translatedContent: For precompiled bundles for Windows see the releases page (https://github.com/matkuki/ExCo/releases/latest).

originContent: Copyright (c) 2013-2025 Matic Kukovec. All rights reserved.
translatedContent: Copyright (c) 2013-2025 Matic Kukovec. All rights reserved.

originContent: All additional licenses are specified at the beginning of every source code file and in text file format in the ```additional_licenses``` directory. If I made any mistakes, please open an issue.
translatedContent: All additional licenses are specified at the beginning of every source code file and in text file format in the ```additional_licenses``` directory. If I made any mistakes, please open an issue.

originContent: - All standard text editor functionality (copy, cut, paste, ...)
translatedContent: - All standard text editor functionality (copy, cut, paste, ...)

originContent: - 'Function wheel' for quick access to most of Ex.Co.'s functionality
translatedContent: - 'Function wheel' for quick access to most of Ex.Co.'s functionality

originContent: - Integrated Python single/multi-line REPL (Read-Eval-Print Loop) for direct access/manipulation of each editor window text and all other functionality
translatedContent: - Integrated Python single/multi-line REPL (Read-Eval-Print Loop) for direct access/manipulation of each editor window text and all other functionality

originContent: - Execute Terminal/Shell commands directly from the REPL (Windows or Linux)
translatedContent: - Execute Terminal/Shell commands directly from the REPL (Windows or Linux)

originContent: - Ability to add your custom Python functions
translatedContent: - Ability to add your custom Python functions

originContent: - Language syntax highlighting: AVS, Ada, Bash, Batch, CMake, CPP, CSS, CSharp, CoffeeScript, Cython, D, Diff, Fortran, Fortran77, HTML, IDL, Java, JavaScript, Lua, Makefile, Matlab, Nim, Oberon, Octave, PO, POV, Pascal, Perl, PostScript, Properties, Python, RouterOS (MikroTik), Ruby, SQL, Spice, TCL, TeX, Text, VHDL, Verilog, XML and YAML
translatedContent: - Language syntax highlighting: AVS, Ada, Bash, Batch, CMake, CPP, CSS, CSharp, CoffeeScript, Cython, D, Diff, Fortran, Fortran77, HTML, IDL, Java, JavaScript, Lua, Makefile, Matlab, Nim, Oberon, Octave, PO, POV, Pascal, Perl, PostScript, Properties, Python, RouterOS (MikroTik), Ruby, SQL, Spice, TCL, TeX, Text, VHDL, Verilog, XML and YAML

originContent: - __Linux__ (tested on Ubuntu, Lubuntu, Mint, Fedora, Raspbian (Raspberry pi, pi2, pi3 and pi4))
translatedContent: - __Linux__ (tested on Ubuntu, Lubuntu, Mint, Fedora, Raspbian (Raspberry pi, pi2, pi3 and pi4))

originContent: - __Mac OS__ (Many thanks to __zenlc2000__ for testing this on Mac OS 10.11)
translatedContent: - __Mac OS__ (Many thanks to __zenlc2000__ for testing this on Mac OS 10.11)

originContent: - __Packages__ install them with: `pip install -r requirements.txt` (check the file for more details)
translatedContent: - __Packages__ install them with: `pip install -r requirements.txt` (check the file for more details)
